result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylon Ryan Okrzesik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to report to Probation/Parole by end of day September 1, 2022

miscConds.notes: Defendant to obtain a High School Diploma, GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term.
Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 9:21 AM: Defendant Dylon Ryan Okrzesik in court, in custody.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Dylon Ryan Okrzesik.  Attorney Dennis J Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Counts 1 & 2 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W - 2 years probation. Conditions: As to Count 1 only: 54 days WC Jail, 54 days CFTS - Time served sentence. As to both counts: Defendant to obtain a High School Diploma, GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term. Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. DE to report to Probation/Parole by the end of the day September 1, 2022. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Dylon Ryan Okrzesik.  Attorney Margaret Struve appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Atty Rae requesting a P/S hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called @ 1:26 PM Defendant Dylon Ryan Okrzesik in court, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Dylon Ryan Okrzesik. Information filed. Complaint stated - Advised of potential punishment. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG Plea entered as to both counts. STC scheduled - NOH given.

Status conference on August 30, 2022 at 08:45 am.

DEFENDANT IS PROHIBITED FROM BEING IN POSSESSION OF ANY CURRENCY GREATER THAN $20.00

Case called @ 1:35 PM Defendant Dylon Ryan Okrzesik appeared by video.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae appeared by video for Dylon Ryan Okrzesik. Statement by the Court regarding warrant return. Bond argument by ADA Ryan. Bond argument by Atty Rae. Court orders: $3500 cash bond. All conditions of bond previously established continue. Court makes Riverside ruling in favor of the state. Atty Rae advises they are prepared to proceed with the IA today. DE voluntary waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Arraignment Scheduled - NOH Given.
Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Arraignment on July 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant in Waushara Co. Jail

Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant requests counsel - referred to SPD.
